Observation¶

observation.py contains data structures to hold quantities commonly found in an observation.

class observation.Angles(incidence_angles, emission_angles, phase_angles)¶

Create a data structure that contains angles required by DISORT.

Angles accepts observation angles and computes \(\mu, \mu_0, \phi\), and \(\phi_0\) from these angles.

__init__(incidence_angles, emission_angles, phase_angles)¶
Parameters

  • incidence_angles (np.ndarray) – Pixel incidence angles [degrees].

  • emission_angles (np.ndarray) – Pixel emission angles [degrees].

  • phase_angles (np.ndarray) – Pixel phase angles [degrees].

Raises

ValueError – Raised if any of the input arrays contain non-numeric values, if any of the angles contain values outside of their mathematically valid range, or if the input arrays do not have the same shape.

Notes

pyRT_DISORT computes all angular quantities across multiple pixels at once to save computation time, but each DISORT run can only be done on a per-pixel basis. Therefore, each element in mu, mu0, phi, and phi0 are the expected DISORT inputs.

property emission¶

Get the input emission angles [degrees].

Returns

The input emission angles.

Return type

np.ndarray

property incidence¶

Get the input incidence (solar zenith) angles [degrees].

Returns

The input incidence angles.

Return type

np.ndarray

property mu¶

Get \(\mu\) where \(\mu\) is the cosine of the input emission angles.

Returns

The cosine of the input emission angles.

Return type

np.ndarray

Notes

Each element in this variable is named “UMU” in DISORT.

property mu0¶

Get \(\mu_0\) where \(\mu_0\) is the cosine of the input incidence angles.

Returns

The cosine of the input incidence angles.

Return type

np.ndarray

Notes

Each element in this variable is named “UMU0” in DISORT.

property phase¶

Get the input phase angles [degrees].

Returns

The input phase angles.

Return type

np.ndarray

property phi¶

Get \(\phi\) where \(\phi\) is the azimuth angle [degrees].

Returns

The azimuth angles.

Return type

np.ndarray

Notes

Each element in this variable is named “PHI” in DISORT.

property phi0¶

Get \(\phi_0\). I assume this is always 0.

Returns

All 0s.

Return type

np.ndarray

Notes

Each element in this variable is named “PHI0” in DISORT.

class observation.Wavelengths(short_wavelengths, long_wavelengths)¶

Create a data structure that contains spectral info for DISORT.

Wavelengths accepts observation wavelengths and computes their corresponding wavenumbers.

__init__(short_wavelengths, long_wavelengths)¶
Parameters

  • short_wavelengths (np.ndarray) – The short wavelengths [microns] for each spectral bin.

  • long_wavelengths (np.ndarray) – The long wavelengths [microns] for each spectral bin.

Raises

  • IndexError – Raised if the input wavelengths are not the same shape.

  • TypeError – Raised if any of the inputs are not np.ndarrays.

  • ValueError – Raised if any of the input spectral arrays are not 1D arrays, contain non-numeric values, contain non positive finite values, if they are not both the same shape, or if any value in long_wavelengths is not larger than the corresponding value in short_wavelengths.

Warning

UserWarning

Raised if any of the input wavelengths are not between 0.1 and 50 microns

Notes

DISORT does not require either short_wavelengths or long_wavelengths, but these quantities are useful to use in pyRT_DISORT in order to obtain the spectral dependence of aerosol radiative properties. The corresponding wavenumbers are only sometimes used by DISORT. See the instance variable docstrings for more details.

property high_wavenumber¶

Get the high wavenumbers [1/cm]—the wavenumbers corresponding to short_wavelength.

Returns

The high wavenumbers.

Return type

np.ndarray

Notes

In DISORT, this variable is named “WVNMHI”. It is only needed by DISORT if thermal_emission (defined in ThermalEmission) == True, or if DISORT is run multiple times and BDREF is spectrally dependent.

property long_wavelengths¶

Get the input long wavelengths [microns].

Returns

The long wavelengths.

Return type

np.ndarray

property low_wavenumber¶

Get the low wavenumbers [1/cm]—the wavenumbers associated with long_wavelength.

Returns

The low wavenumbers.

Return type

np.ndarray

Notes

In DISORT, this variable is named “WVNMLO”. It is only needed by DISORT if thermal_emission (defined in ThermalEmission) == True, or if DISORT is run multiple times and BDREF is spectrally dependent.

property short_wavelengths¶

Get the input short wavelengths [microns].

Returns

The short wavelengths.

Return type

np.ndarray
